info.title: spoonacular API
info.description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 380,000 recipes, thousands of ingredients, 800,000 food products, and 100,000 menu items. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, whole 30, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Primal.

parameters.name: cuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine(s) of the recipes. One or more, comma separated (will be interpreted as 'OR'). See a full list of supported cuisines.

parameters.name: excludeCuisine
parameters.description: The cuisine(s) the recipes must not match. One or more, comma separated (will be interpreted as 'AND'). See a full list of supported cuisines.

parameters.name: diet
parameters.description: The diet for which the recipes must be suitable. See a full list of supported diets.

parameters.name: intolerances
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of intolerances. All recipes returned must not contain ingredients that are not suitable for people with the intolerances entered. See a full list of supported intolerances.

parameters.name: equipment
parameters.description: The equipment required. Multiple values will be interpreted as 'or'. For example, value could be "blender, frying pan, bowl".

parameters.name: includeIngredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that should/must be used in the recipes.

parameters.name: excludeIngredients
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients or ingredient types that the recipes must not contain.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of recipe. See a full list of supported meal types.

parameters.name: instructionsRequired
parameters.description: Whether the recipes must have instructions.

parameters.name: fillIngredients
parameters.description: Add information about the ingredients and whether they are used or missing in relation to the query.

parameters.name: addRecipeInformation
parameters.description: If set to true, you get more information about the recipes returned.

parameters.name: addRecipeNutrition
parameters.description: If set to true, you get nutritional information about each recipes returned.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The username of the recipe author.

parameters.name: recipeBoxId
parameters.description: The id of the recipe box to which the search should be limited to.

parameters.name: titleMatch
parameters.description: Enter text that must be found in the title of the recipes.

parameters.name: maxReadyTime
parameters.description: The maximum time in minutes it should take to prepare and cook the recipe.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The strategy to sort recipes by. See a full list of supported sorting options.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: The direction in which to sort. Must be either 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending).

parameters.name: minCarbs

get.description: Search through hundreds of thousands of recipes using advanced filtering and ranking. NOTE: This method combines searching by query, by ingredients, and by nutrients into one endpoint.

parameters.name: ranking
parameters.description: Whether to maximize used ingredients (1) or minimize missing ingredients (2) first.

get.description: Ever wondered what recipes you can cook with the ingredients you have in your fridge or pantry? This endpoint lets you find recipes that either maximize the usage of ingredients you have at hand (pre shopping) or minimize the ingredients that you don't currently have (post shopping).

parameters.name: random
parameters.description: If true, every request will give you a random set of recipes within the requested limits.

get.description: Find a set of recipes that adhere to the given nutritional limits. You may set limits for macronutrients (calories, protein, fat, and carbohydrate) and/or many micronutrients.

example-1.title: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs

extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower florets
extendedIngredients.original: about 2 cups frozen cauliflower florets, thawed, cut into bite-sized pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: about frozen cauliflower florets, thawed, cut into bite-sized pieces

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.original: couple of pinches red pepper flakes, optional
extendedIngredients.originalName: couple of red pepper flakes, optional

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 3 scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated
extendedIngredients.originalName: scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated

extendedIngredients.name: whole wheat bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup whole wheat bread crumbs (I used panko)
extendedIngredients.originalName: whole wheat bread crumbs (I used panko)

example-1.summary: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs might be a good recipe to expand your main course repertoire. One portion of this dish contains approximately 19g of protein , 20g of fat , and a total of 584 calories . For $1.63 per serving , this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. It is brought to you by fullbellysisters.blogspot.com. 209 people were glad they tried this recipe. A mixture of scallions, salt and pepper, white wine, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes . All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 83% . This score is awesome. If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Cauliflower Gratin with Garlic Breadcrumbs, < href="https://spoonacular.com/recipes/pasta-with-cauliflower-sausage-breadcrumbs-30437">Pasta With Cauliflower, Sausage, & Breadcrumbs, and Pasta With Roasted Cauliflower, Parsley, And Breadcrumbs.

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Pasta. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 25 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay
productMatches.description: We barrel ferment our Chardonnay and age it in a mix of Oak and Stainless. Giving this light bodied wine modest oak character, a delicate floral aroma, and a warming finish.

value.title: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs

get.description: Get an analyzed breakdown of a recipe's instructions. Each step is enriched with the ingredients and equipment required.

example-1.summary: The recipe Soy-and-Ginger-Glazed Salmon with Udon Noodles can be made in approximately 1 hour and 35 minutes . One portion of this dish contains about 48g of protein , 17g of fat , and a total of 552 calories . This recipe serves 4. For $5.91 per serving , this recipe covers 47% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as a main course. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by Food and Wine. If you have fresh ginger, udon noodles, salmon fillets, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92% . This score is great. If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Salmon With Soy-ginger Noodles, Ginger-Soy Salmon With Soba Noodles, and Soy & ginger salmon with soba noodles.
example-1.title: Soy-and-Ginger-Glazed Salmon with Udon Noodles

If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Salmon With Soy-ginger Noodles, Ginger-Soy Salmon With Soba Noodles, and Soy & ginger salmon with soba noodles.
value.title: Soy-and-Ginger-Glazed Salmon with Udon Noodles

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The recipe id.

get.description: Automatically generate a short description that summarizes key information about the recipe.

ingredients.name: ingredients
ingredients.description: A comma-separated list of ingredients that the recipes should contain.

number.name: number
number.description: The maximum number of items to return (between 1 and 100). Defaults to 10.

ignorePantry.name: ignorePantry
ignorePantry.description: Whether to ignore typical pantry items, such as water, salt, flour, etc.

limitLicense.name: limitLicense
limitLicense.description: Whether the recipes should have an open license that allows display with proper attribution.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The number of results to skip (between 0 and 900).

includeNutrition.name: includeNutrition
includeNutrition.description: Include nutrition data in the recipe information. Nutrition data is per serving. If you want the nutrition data for the entire recipe, just multiply by the number of servings.

tags.name: tags
tags.description: The tags (can be diets, meal types, cuisines, or intolerances) that the recipe must have.

includeTaste.name: includeTaste
includeTaste.description: Whether taste data should be added to correctly parsed ingredients.

defaultCss.name: defaultCss
defaultCss.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

language.name: language
language.description: The language of the input. Either 'en' or 'de'.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: The private hash for the username.

rgb.name: rgb
rgb.description: Red, green, blue values for the chart color.
